question: Physician prescribes HRT (hormone replacement tablets) in order to enhance her monthly cycle which gives her relief. Will the enhanced bleeding be regarded as Haydh?
answer:
QUESTION
During menopause generally a female's monthly cycle of bleeding is suppressed resulting in her experiencing hot flushes and other medical complications. Her physician prescribes HRT (hormone replacement tablets) in order to enhance her monthly cycle which gives her relief. Will the enhanced bleeding be regarded as Haydh?
ANSWER


Share:
The enhanced bleeding by HRT (hormone replacement tablets) will be
regarded as Haydh. (Shaami vol.1 pg.222; Rashidiyya)
The same ruling applies for a female who attained the age of despair
(Sinne-Iyaas) of 50 years. During Haydh (menstruation), a female cannot
perform Salaat, fast, recite and touch the Qur'aan and make Tawaaf.

From: Al Mahmood 13 Q & A from the Darul Ifta
Mufti Ebrahim Desai
